data.title: fixed ios compilation error
Collision mesh generation for all selected mesh nodes at once.
data.body: Should be an easy one to do, perhaps you can change the _create static tri-mesh_ operation to one that loops over all of the selected **mesh instance** nodes and as such creates a static body and a  collider for all of them.

data.title: (Better Collada Exporter):: Option for automatic object splitting by material
data.body:
As the title says. Currently, it seems that Godot does not properly support multi-material objects so we have to split them in Blender before exporting. The issue though is that you have to join them back up if you need to make further edits to the level or object in question.

The solution would be a checkbox in the _Better Collada_ exporter (along with the Godot Export manager) to automatically split objects by material during the export process, which would simplify and speed up level creation. I decided it would be a good time to request that since the focus right now is on usability.

If you can take a look, thanks.

data.title: IMPORT:: New meshes introduced into scene lose their name
data.body:
To test...

---
1. Export an initial set of meshes to Collada and import into Godot
2. Introduce a new set of meshes to the scene's Collada file
3. Re-import the scene using the _merge with new_ option

The result:: the initial set of meshes should have their names assigned to their nodes, but all future objects will simply be called **mesh instance** with a number by them. I'm pretty sure this may be on Godot's end but I'm not sure.

data.title: Area2D Reports Incorrect Collision Information Immediate After Calling set_pos()
data.body:
In a function if you move an Area2D via set_pos() then call get_overlapping_areas(), Godot will report the collision iteration from the previous iteration, not the current information.

I've created an example that demonstrates this behavior at http://home.comcast.net/~hammerbro/CollisionExample.zip

If you press Left, the two Area2Ds will move to the opposite ends of the screen. If you press Right, they will move to an overlapping position in the center. If you press Space Bar, the current collision information will be printed.

When you first press Right, the Area2Ds will overlap, but within that same function call they will report that they are not overlapping. If you press Space after that they will then report that they do overlap, even though they haven't moved. When you next press Left, they will report that they do overlap, even though they're no longer close to each other. Again, Space will report accurate information, but only because some number of game loops have passed since they were moved.

data.title: panel instance hidden state not saved
data.body:
Create a scene with a Panel as its root, and hide the Panel.  Instance that scene into another scene.  Unhide the instance, save, and close editor.  Reopen, and the instance is hidden again.

Example:
https://copy.com/mw0c8PXITNGOCere

data.title: Made new subscene behaviour a button on scene tree dock
data.body:
This fixes #2214 

BTW this is also my first time touching the Godot code (hopefully first of many!) but everything seems to work still. :)

data.title: slow processing of input events
data.body:
I'm currently working on improving joystick handling, and noticed that going wild on the analog sticks dramatically reduces performance due to parsing a large number of input events.
On low end devices (2006 laptop and xperia z2) this can drop fps down to zero with even just a single gamepad.
In my code, I'm filtering out events below a user set threshold from the hardware stream. But still, having multiple devices sending out axis events can impact performance quite a bit.

According to callgrind most of the work comes from `call_group()` in `SceneTree::input_event()`

data.title: Tool access to object's property list
data.body:
Right now tools have a limited access to the editor (or at least the documentation isn't really descriptive about what you can do). Exports also provide a limited ability to expose functionality to the artists, so I thought what could we do to extend this in some way.

I guess the easiest way to do this would be to expose the property list directly to a script. That way programmers could create GUI elements as they please, and then retrieve the values. The only issue would be saving the property values of custom elements in a scene file - export/import callbacks maybe?

A trivial example:
I'd like to allow my artist to select properties from a set of checkboxes. I will need:
- Access to a GUI field where I could insert the checkboxes and a layout
- A way to tell Godot what is the value of my GUI fields for saving (serialization)
- A way for Godot to tell me what value is stored in a scene when loading, to properly setup the checkboxes (deserialization)

So I think simple callbacks for scripts could be easiest to integrate with the current state of things.

```
export(func, int, "_myGUISetup", "_mySerializer", "_myDeserializer") var MyPropertyBox;

func _myGUISetup(parent):
    pass # Put a layout inside of the parent, put checkboxes inside of the layout

func _mySerializer(parent):
    pass # Read checkbox state and return an int value (defined in export) representing the state of the proprty, called on scene save

func _myDeserializer(parent, serializedState):
    pass # Called after _myGUISetup with serializedState if a value is saved in a scene
```

Things to think about:
- Could animations be used with this? (I guess it depends on the implementation specifics)
- Could plugins be used with this? (defining function names in the export might be a bad idea, maybe plugins could define a custom type for the export name `export("pluginCustomField") var MyPluginProperty`)

Use examples:
- Countless really, depends on needs
- A field allowing selection of an interpolation function with factor selection and an image rendering a plot of it
- GDScript implementation of arrays of properties (Unity property lists equivalent)
- Selection of a postprocessing filter to use with a preview
- A field for file selection with a button
- Diagnostic read-only fields showing some properties like distance to the end of a map or anything else requiring runtime calculations in the scene

data.title: PhysicsShapeQueryParameters.sphere_cast
data.body:
([forum discussion](http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?t=2175&p=10282))

[Unity's SphereCast](http://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Physics.SphereCast.html) is quite an elementary and useful function.

To be fair, it seems it seems (I'm not sure though) is somehow possible to achieve a similar thing using the current API, but it is overly complicated and half of it isn't even documented. 

Please add a similar high-level function to godot.

data.title: Crash when opening Godot with secondary monitor
data.body:
Godot opened correctly the first time. I played a little bit with it. After that, it always crashed.

Macbook Air 11' from early 2015 + Secondary monitor.
Mac OSX Yosemite.

Godot opens always correctly without the secondary monitor.

Edited: removed crash log.

data.title: Sound pitch keeping the original tempo (speed)
data.body:
Hi,
I'm trying to create a little music tracker in godot (just for fun) to create music using modern tools and touch inputs. I notice the the pitch method stretch the audio (speed) without keepeing the tempo. I found a nice opensource library that does it http://www.surina.net/soundtouch/ .Would be a nice add-on on godot.

data.title: Rename "subscene" menu item and move it
data.body:
Okay this is a bit of a weird one, but the way I've been developing now has been to mock objects inside a scene as child nodes as tests. Inevitably, if it's all okay and the complexity necessitates it, I keep needing to upgrade them to their own scenes for instancing. This means painstakingly rebuilding the node and it's children. (Or copying the scene and deleting everything that isn't what I want.) 

I don't know what the feasability of this would be, but a way to take a node (and all it's children) and upgrade them to their own scene file would greatly help this workflow.

Also happy to get some discussion on this particular workflow and even if I'm just "doing it wrong". I don't think having hindsight is a super great answer to it though as that goes against experimentation and rapid development.

data.title: Area with zero gravity not works correctly.
data.body: In 3D scene, I am trying to set zero gravity, but when the game start all rigid bodies are falling for 5 seconds very slowly and then they stop, they must start with no velocity.

data.title: A small bug in the script editor ('\' simbol)
data.body:
Hi. The calculation does not include padding string after the operator '\'. (wrap long lines)
This is evident in the allocation of lines debugger. Ie debugger highlights the line located above the erroneous line in the Number of characters '\' code.

data.title: [3D] Graphical artefacts when Ambient Light, Omni-Light and Spot light on the same scene
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Initially seen on 1.1-stable

When on the scene there are Ambient Light (from WorldEnviroment) and omni-light together with spotlights then depending on camera position some graphical artefacts will appear, video reference here:
http://youtu.be/JG0xGrrzBaQ
If we add on the scene also directional light the artefacts will disappear (even if energy of directional light is 0).
Here is a project that replicate this issue:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/Omni_Spot_lights_issue.7z

data.title: Anti alias and particle in divided view
data.body:
Hello.

Especially it is seen in Navmesh Demo, divided viewport shows blurry anti alias, and too accelerated particle speed compared to single view.

https://kie.nu/2CDC
https://kie.nu/2CDD

Anti alias might be nvidia specific, though I'm not sure.
I would appreciate if you could look into this.

Thanks.

Gentoo Linux 3.18.12 64bit
Nvidia 349.16

data.title: accumulate mouse movement events
data.body: Many small mouse movement events from the window manager being processed by many Controls can slow down performance to seconds per frame territory.  These events need to be accumulated by the engine each frame, and the cumulative mouse movement sent to the Controls to process.  This could be made optional, as it might be desirable to know the _exact_ path the mouse took through each substep during the frame.

data.title: Error ld cannot find -lGL when compiling in Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
As title says, I'm trying to compile godot in Ubuntu 14.04
I have run the command:

```
apt-get install scons pkg-config libx11-dev libxcursor-dev build-essential libasound2-dev libfreetype6-dev libgl1-mesa-dev libglu-dev libssl-dev libxinerama-dev
```

and I thought I had all dependencies needed.. but it turns out I don't.
After running:
`scons platform=x11`
It returns with error:

```
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lGL
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
scons: *** [bin/godot.x11.tools.64] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

Can someone help me debug this problem ? I don't know which library GL is.

data.title: UI Concept for Godot
data.body:
Hi there,

This weekend I worked on a conceptual UI for Godot. My focus was on getting a clear and coherent design that can be flexible (fully dockable) and easy to expand in the future, and also up to date with current UX patterns on most 3d related apps. Please take a look and tell me what you think. The concept was first posted on the Godot IRC channel. Thanks to @xodene for the idea of posting the design here.

![gdoto_basic_layout_concept_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6024473/8400490/301e7198-1de9-11e5-9071-e95583bb5827.png)

About the design
- Font used is Source Sans Pro, an open source font made by Adobe. This font has many weights and alternatives, including an mono spaced version, which suits perfect for scripting.
- Current icons are from Font Awesome, a set of open source icons well known in web development. My plan is to make a complete set of custom designed icons for Godot, but this could take a lot of time, so for know I sticking with this icon set, just for testing purposes.
- I took some freedom an added random icons and features, this helps me to see how the layout works.

**Update on Oct 13, 2015**
Hi everyone! I finally got time to continue my work on the UI. Here is a quick update on the interface that include some of the features you mentioned on the comments.

![gdoto_ui_concept_02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6024473/10529944/4143bdf6-736c-11e5-86e7-a5fb465a772e.png)

I also want to share with you a logo design concept I have been working on in parallel with the UI. This logo is my attempt to a fully coherent and modern Godot visual identity that initially starts with the UI design. Here I tried to simplify the current logo and make it more serious, solid and unique; as well as play well with different sizes and colors.

![gdoto_logotype_concept_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6024473/10529960/64be9ba2-736c-11e5-8efd-8b2de84296c6.png)

As always feel free to let any feedback you want; that's best way to iterate!

data.title: Non-power of 2 textures don't repeat
data.body:
If you use a texture which isn't power of 2 (or at least the same width/height) then the repeat texture flag doesn't work, or stops working very quickly. 

I've looked through the source to see if I can see the problem, but I haven't had any luck so far.

data.title: Import BMFont sprite font
data.body: The functionality exists in the code to read BMFont files, so it would be nice to be able to use them in the editor.

data.title: Fix android payments
data.body:
I compiled with latest commit (2b64f73b0459190d20b2f6de39275ee7979317c4) and run on HTC nexus 9 (android 5.1.1).

```
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:698)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524): Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Service Intent must be explicit: Intent { act=com.android.vending.billing.InAppBillingService.BIND }
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.app.ContextImpl.validateServiceIntent(ContextImpl.java:1680)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.app.ContextImpl.bindServiceCommon(ContextImpl.java:1779)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.app.ContextImpl.bindService(ContextImpl.java:1757)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.content.ContextWrapper.bindService(ContextWrapper.java:539)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at com.android.godot.payments.PaymentsManager.initService(PaymentsManager.java:50)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at com.android.godot.Godot.initializeGodot(Godot.java:367)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at com.android.godot.Godot.onCreate(Godot.java:532)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5990)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1106)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2278)
06-29 02:42:36.194: E/AndroidRuntime(5524):     ... 10 more
```

I fixed this error by this (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24480069/google-in-app-billing-illegalargumentexception-service-intent-must-be-explicit).

I tested this Nexus 9 (5.1.1), Galaxy S3 (4.1.2), LG-SU760 (2.3.5).
and works fine.

data.title: Direct change character in String
data.body:
I have a string and I want to change char in some position:

```
    var text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
    text[7] = 'a'
    print(text)
```

but output is result:

```
    The quak brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
```

It is replace "ic" with 'a'.

data.title: Crash inserting white space at first line of script.
data.body:
The crash occurs after inserting a white space at the first line of a script and before any other character (except for white spaces).

Crash error:

``` sh
ERROR: get_token_identifier: Condition ' tk_rb[ofs].type!=TK_IDENTIFIER ' is true. returned: StringName()
   At: modules/gdscript/gd_tokenizer.cpp:972.
```

data.title: Add typed variables to GDScript
data.body:
So right now, every variable can be one of three types...
- Constant - it has one value and one value only
- Dynamic - it can have its value changed to one of any type from a string to a vector3
- Exported - this allows you to have an adjustable value for each instance of an object

However, the downside with having to use dynamic types with all possible values that are changeable is that they are not the fastest solution around. Now I propose that GDscript gets a third main variable type, **static**.

The main benefit I can see is that it can potentially make scripts a bit faster, this will not replace the general dynamic type, but merely give the developer another way to optimize logic and make code more readable (because the interpreter would not have to check what type the value is and will throw an error if the wrong type of value is assigned).

---

The syntax would work similar to how the export system works, so you could have like...

```
static var health = int(5)
static var percent = float(12.5)
static var message = "hello"
static var rotation = Vector3(0,1,0)
static var list = [0,1,2,3,4]
static var blue = Color(0,0.5,1)
```

Would this be worth adding to Godot (which would depend on how much speed gain scripts can get in practice)?

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer doesn't reset non-looping animations, so they are not displayed correctly
data.body:
oneshot node in AnimationTrePlayer is provided to be able to add single animation,
which played once on demand blending from existing animation to that, playing it, then blending back
to previous animation. It is intended to be started as many times as necessary to replay animation.
This can be used, for example, as weapon swing animation during looped idle or walk animation - 
it swings, then gets back to original.
However now it only plays animation properly once. I'm not sure since which time, but when I am played last with AnimationTreePlayer it was working normally.

This demo application demonstractes the problem : http://ossfans.org/simple.tgz
You can open roomctl.scn and run it (no main scene setting there).
You can walk by cursor keys, jump pressing space and pressing Ctrl (left?) for 'punch' action.
The punch action plays 'punch' animation, but fails to repeat again (it looks ok only once).
If played by normal animation player, animation works fine.
You can check animations openning player.scn, selecting 'anim' node.
Script running animation is character.gd. But it all can be tested openning player.scn and pressing Start button on oneshot node named "punch".

The problem is not only with oneshot node, but with any non-looping animation.
This is broken somewhere after 1.1 if I'm not wrong.

data.title: Compiling Android with too many arguments
data.body: I've been looking into compiling Android on Windows, and been playing with different options. The latest I did was "scons platform=android x86=yes" which worked up until linking. I couldn't even see the start of the command but it ends with "The parameter is incorrect." I've looked into it and found that Windows has a maximum character limit for command line arguments. This may be a start for finding a fix for compiling Android on Windows.

data.title: RayCast node doesn't display ray if length is < 0.5
data.body:
RayCast node doesn't display ray if length is < 0.5
If size is less, the ray is not displayed in editor (which makes it hard to setup).

(Cast to field)
Enter 0.0 -0.2 0.0 - ray disappears
Enter 0.0 -0.5 0.0 - ray appears
